ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: It is Our army which will be victorious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: And that certainly Our armies will be victorious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: and that Our hosts shall triumph.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: and that Our army will be triumphant.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: And surely, only Our army will be victorious.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_5: And that Our hosts! they verily would be the victors.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: And most surely Our host alone shall be the victorious ones.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_7: and Our host -- they are the victors.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: And that Our host, they verily would be the victors.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: and that it is Our host that would certainly triumph.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: And verily Our host! they are to be overcome.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_11: and indeed Our hosts will be the victors.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: And that Our forces,- they surely must conquer.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: And that Our hosts, they verily would be the victors.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: and Our armies shall be the victors.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_15: And Our troops will be the victors.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: And [that] indeed, Our soldiers will be those who overcome.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [37:173] and assuredly Our hosts, namely, the believers, they will indeed be the victors, over the disbelievers by [their being given] the definitive proofs and assistance against them in this world. And if some of these [believers] are not victorious over them in this world, then assuredly in the Hereafter [they will be so].
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: (And that Our host) the messengers and believers, (they verily would be the victors) by means of proof and numbers until the Day of Judgement.
